definition[0]: used to say that someone has said two things at once that are so different from each other they cannot both be true
example[0]: He criticized the film, then predicted in the same breath that it would be a great success.
definition[1]: if you mention two people or things in the same breath, you show that you think they are alike or are related
example[1]: I became nervous when the doctor mentioned my mother’s name and ‘cancer’ in the same breath.
example[2]: a young poet mentioned in the same breath as T.S. Eliot
